bug.author: abhi-g
bug.summary: Kubeflow version displayed on the UI is wrong
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Deploy Kubeflow from v0.6 branch What did you expect to happen: I expected the Central Dashboard UI to show Kubeflow Version as 0.6.x, instead it shows v1beta1 Anything else you would like to add: Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): Should be v0.6.0
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11774566/62901866-bb3e6400-bd12-11e9-92fe-06b43ca79ca7.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 1.00. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Central dashboard <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/b0315cb4e95af11eb40257d7d97e294a04678ca4/components/centraldashboard/app/k8s_service.ts#L137>version discovery</denchmark-link> code is retrieving this value from some K8s application. Seems like there is a miscommunication or misalignment on the version information. /assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link> we'll need the fix in the 0.6.2 patch release
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> Has this already been fixed in the image in kubeflow/manifests on v0.6-branch?

I'm seeing v1beta in the central dashboard when I deployed using the latest kfctl branch and the latest central dashboard image. I think there are two problems <denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> The centraldashboard code doesn't look correct to me.
It looks like it is listing applications and returning the version specified in the first application it finds. We should be looking for the application named kubeflow (we can issue a get for it rather than listing all applications). (see kubectl command and output below). The second problem looks like the version set in the application resource is not correct. It looks like we are currently setting the version to v1beta1. We need to fix that. This needs to be fixed in the manifest <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/eab125dd42c08b0e2495b7b2d7a7010ac64d3774/application/application/overlays/application/application.yaml#L16>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/eab125dd42c08b0e2495b7b2d7a7010ac64d3774/application/application/overlays/application/application.yaml#L16</denchmark-link>
e.g <denchmark-code>kubectl -n kubeflow get applications kubeflow -o yaml apiVersion: app.k8s.io/v1beta1 kind: Application metadata: creationTimestamp: 2019-08-21T13:17:51Z generation: 1 labels: app.kubernetes.io/component: kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/instance: kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kfctl app.kubernetes.io/name: kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/part-of: kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/version: v0.6 name: kubeflow namespace: kubeflow ownerReferences: - apiVersion: app.k8s.io/v1beta1 blockOwnerDeletion: true controller: false kind: Application name: kubeflow uid: 13e849fc-c416-11e9-a068-42010a8e006a resourceVersion: "10889" selfLink: /apis/app.k8s.io/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/applications/kubeflow uid: 13e849fc-c416-11e9-a068-42010a8e006a spec: addOwnerRef: true componentKinds: - group: app.k8s.io kind: Application descriptor: description: application that aggregates all kubeflow applications keywords: - kubeflow links: - description: About url: https://kubeflow.org maintainers: - email: jlewi@google.com name: Jeremy Lewi - email: kam.d.kasravi@intel.com name: Kam Kasravi owners: - email: jlewi@google.com name: Jeremy Lewi type: kubeflow version: v1beta1 selector: matchLabels: app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kfctl app.kubernetes.io/part-of: kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/version: v0.6 status: components: - link: /apis/app.k8s.io/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/applications/kubeflow name: kubeflow status: Ready - link: /apis/app.k8s.io/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/applications/centraldashboard name: centraldashboard status: Ready - link: /apis/app.k8s.io/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/applications/jupyter-web-app name: jupyter-web-app status: Ready - link: /apis/app.k8s.io/v1beta1/namespaces/kubeflow/applications/notebook-controller name: notebook-controller status: Ready conditions: - lastTransitionTime: 2019-08-21T13:17:57Z lastUpdateTime: 2019-08-21T13:17:57Z message: all components ready reason: ComponentsReady status: "True" type: Ready - lastTransitionTime: 2019-08-21T13:17:57Z lastUpdateTime: 2019-08-21T13:17:57Z message: No error seen reason: NoError status: "False" type: Error </denchmark-code>

I tried with <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/c3199d931b9b82c8717057c7aca883d76bb5e1d5/bootstrap/config/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.6.2rc.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/c3199d931b9b82c8717057c7aca883d76bb5e1d5/bootstrap/config/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.6.2rc.yaml</denchmark-link>
and I'm still seeing v1beta1 in the UI. It looks like the version in the kubeflow application is fixed; now 0.6.2. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/3535056/application.txt>application.txt</denchmark-link>
So I think the problem is that the UI is showing the version of the first application returned and not looking at the Kubeflow application. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/3535063/centraldashboard.txt>centraldashboard.txt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avdaredevil>@avdaredevil</denchmark-link> we need to fix the centraldashboard code to look for the kubeflow application and not just use the first application. However, a quick fix <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> might be to just bump the version in the Application manifest for the centraldashboard. We should do that anyway because the version should be v0.6.2 not v1beta1.
It also looks like when I'm logged in as the user that deployed Kubeflow it doesn't think I'm the manager and show me the namespace creation UI.

Could these be because we don't have the central dashboard PRs cherrypicked into v0.6-branch yet? <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Fri, Aug 23, 2019 at 8:12 AM Jeremy Lewi ***@***.***> wrote: It also looks like when I'm logged in as the user that deployed Kubeflow it doesn't think I'm the manager and show me the namespace creation UI.
‚Äî You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Kubeflow <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3994>#3994</denchmark-link> uses <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/commit/1099a06>kubeflow/manifests@1099a06</denchmark-link>
That shows v0.6.2 as the version in the central dashboard because I had updated all the application CRs to set the version to v0.6.2. We would still need to update the centraldashboard image to correctly look at the Kubeflow application to get the version.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3992>#3992</denchmark-link> is supposed to fix that by looking for Kubeflow application. Does it not? <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Sat, Aug 24, 2019 at 12:18 PM Jeremy Lewi ***@***.***> wrote: Kubeflow #3994 <#3994> uses ***@***.*** <kubeflow/manifests@1099a06> That shows v0.6.2 as the version in the central dashboard because I had updated all the application CRs to set the version to v0.6.2. We would still need to update the centraldashboard image to correctly look at the Kubeflow application to get the version.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/abhi-g>@abhi-g</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3994>#3994</denchmark-link> isn't using <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3992>#3992</denchmark-link> (updated centraldahboard yet). I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/311>kubeflow/manifests#311</denchmark-link> updates the kubeflow/manifests@v0.6-branch to pull in the fixed central dashboard. I just lgtm'd <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/311>kubeflow/manifests#311</denchmark-link> .
